name: Introduction to Rocket Propulsion
description: Basic principles of rocket propulsion and rocket engines.

lessons.name: History of Rocketry
lessons.description: A brief history of rocketry and space exploration.

lessons.name: Rocket Propulsion Fundamentals
lessons.description: Basic principles of rocket propulsion.

lessons.name: Rocket Engine Types
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket engines.

name: Fuel and Combustion
description: Understanding rocket fuel, combustion processes, and efficiency.

lessons.name: Rocket Fuel
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket fuels.

lessons.name: Combustion Processes
lessons.description: Understanding combustion processes and efficiency.

lessons.name: Combustion Instability
lessons.description: Understanding combustion instability and mitigation.

name: Nozzle Design
description: Principles of rocket nozzle design and performance optimization.

lessons.name: Nozzle Design
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket nozzles.

lessons.name: Nozzle Performance
lessons.description: Understanding nozzle performance and efficiency.

lessons.name: Nozzle Optimization
lessons.description: Optimizing nozzle design for specific applications.

name: Fundamentals of Aerodynamics
description: An introduction to key aerodynamic principles including fluid dynamics, airfoil behavior, and the forces acting on a body in motion through air.

lessons.name: Principles of Fluid Dynamics
lessons.description: Covers the behavior of air as a fluid, including the continuity equation, pressure gradients, and streamlines.

lessons.name: Airfoils and Lift Generation
lessons.description: Explores airfoil design, Bernoulli’s principle, and how lift is generated in subsonic flows.

lessons.name: Forces in Aerodynamic Motion
lessons.description: Analyzes drag, lift, thrust, and weight, along with their interactions during flight.

name: Subsonic and Supersonic Flow
description: Study of compressible and incompressible flow behavior in subsonic and supersonic regimes, including shockwaves and Mach number dynamics.

lessons.name: Flow Regimes and Mach Number
lessons.description: Defines subsonic, transonic, supersonic, and hypersonic regimes using the Mach number as a classification tool.

lessons.name: Compressibility Effects
lessons.description: Introduces the role of compressibility in high-speed flows and its influence on pressure and temperature fields.

lessons.name: Shock Waves and Expansion Fans
lessons.description: Covers shock formation, expansion waves, and flow deflection mechanisms in supersonic regimes.

name: Aerodynamic Heating and Thermal Protection
description: Explores heat generation in high-speed atmospheric flight and the design of thermal protection systems (TPS) for reentry vehicles.

lessons.name: Sources of Aerodynamic Heating
lessons.description: Explains how kinetic energy transforms into heat during high-velocity flight, especially during atmospheric reentry.

lessons.name: Thermal Analysis Techniques
lessons.description: Introduces analytical models and computational methods for predicting surface temperature rise and heat flux.

lessons.name: Thermal Protection Systems
lessons.description: Examines materials and design strategies for TPS including ablative, radiative, and insulative methods.

name: Spacecraft Structural Design
description: Covers the fundamental principles and practices in designing spacecraft structures to withstand launch, orbital, and reentry conditions.

lessons.name: Structural Requirements and Constraints
lessons.description: Explores load types, launch-induced stresses, and environmental constraints affecting spacecraft structural design.

lessons.name: Materials and Manufacturing for Space
lessons.description: Discusses selection of lightweight, high-strength materials and structural fabrication techniques suitable for space environments.

lessons.name: Structural Testing and Validation
lessons.description: Explains ground testing, vibration, thermal, and modal analysis used to verify spacecraft structural integrity.

name: Orbital Mechanics
description: Introduces the physics of orbital motion, trajectory planning, and space mission analysis based on Newtonian mechanics.

lessons.name: Two-Body Problem and Kepler's Laws
lessons.description: Explains basic orbital motion principles including elliptical orbits, velocity vectors, and Keplerian elements.

lessons.name: Orbital Maneuvers and Transfers
lessons.description: Covers Hohmann transfers, bi-elliptic transfers, and delta-v budgeting for mission planning.

lessons.name: Perturbations and Real-World Orbits
lessons.description: Examines effects of atmospheric drag, Earth oblateness, third-body perturbations, and station-keeping.

name: Spacecraft Systems Engineering
description: Provides a systems-level view of spacecraft design, integration, and verification across multiple engineering disciplines.

lessons.name: Subsystem Overview and Architecture
lessons.description: Introduces major spacecraft subsystems: power, thermal, communications, ADCS, payload, and propulsion.

lessons.name: System Integration and Interfaces
lessons.description: Covers how subsystems are integrated, interface managed, and budgets (mass, power, data) are allocated.

lessons.name: Verification and Validation Lifecycle
lessons.description: Details how testing, simulation, and documentation ensure system requirements are met pre-launch.

name: Structure and Bonding in Organic Molecules
description: Explores atomic structure, hybridization, molecular geometry, and bonding in organic compounds.

lessons.name: Atomic Orbitals and Hybridization
lessons.description: Covers s, p, and sp^n hybrid orbitals, bonding geometry, and resonance.

lessons.name: Functional Groups and Molecular Structure
lessons.description: Introduction to key organic functional groups and their structural representation.

lessons.name: Electronegativity and Polarity
lessons.description: Understanding dipole moments, polarity in bonds, and their impact on reactivity.

name: Stereochemistry and Isomerism
description: Introduces the spatial arrangement of atoms in organic molecules and its effect on reactivity.

lessons.name: Isomer Types and Nomenclature
lessons.description: Covers constitutional isomers, stereoisomers, and basic IUPAC rules.

lessons.name: Chirality and Optical Activity
lessons.description: Understanding chiral centers, enantiomers, and plane-polarized light.

lessons.name: R/S and E/Z Configurations
lessons.description: Learn to assign absolute and geometric configurations to molecules.

name: Reaction Mechanisms and Acid-Base Chemistry
description: Teaches fundamental reaction pathways and acid-base behavior in organic systems.

lessons.name: Acid-Base Concepts in Organic Chemistry
lessons.description: Covers pKa values, conjugate acids/bases, and predicting proton transfer reactions.

lessons.name: Nucleophiles and Electrophiles
lessons.description: Analyzing electron-rich and electron-poor species and their role in reactions.

lessons.name: Introduction to Reaction Mechanisms
lessons.description: Step-by-step breakdown of common mechanisms including arrow-pushing and intermediates.

name: Atomic Structure and Periodicity
description: Introduces atomic models, quantum numbers, and periodic properties of elements.

lessons.name: Quantum Mechanical Model of the Atom
lessons.description: Covers orbitals, quantum numbers, and electron configurations.

lessons.name: Periodic Trends and Effective Nuclear Charge
lessons.description: Explores trends in atomic radius, ionization energy, and electronegativity.

lessons.name: Ionic and Covalent Radii
lessons.description: Discusses size variations across ions and covalent bonding patterns.

name: Chemical Bonding and Molecular Geometry
description: Examines ionic, covalent, and metallic bonding along with VSEPR theory.

lessons.name: Ionic and Covalent Bonding
lessons.description: Differentiates types of bonding and energy considerations.

lessons.name: Molecular Orbital Theory
lessons.description: Introduces MO diagrams and bonding in diatomic molecules.

lessons.name: VSEPR and Geometry Prediction
lessons.description: Uses VSEPR theory to predict 3D molecular shapes.

name: Transition Metals and Coordination Chemistry
description: Focuses on the chemistry of transition metals and coordination compounds.

lessons.name: Transition Metal Properties
lessons.description: Discusses electronic configurations, oxidation states, and color.

lessons.name: Coordination Compounds and Nomenclature
lessons.description: Introduces ligands, coordination numbers, and naming rules.

lessons.name: Crystal Field Theory
lessons.description: Explores d-orbital splitting and magnetism in coordination complexes.

name: Thermodynamics and Energy
description: Explores the fundamental principles of thermodynamics and their role in chemical systems.

lessons.name: Laws of Thermodynamics
lessons.description: Covers the first, second, and third laws of thermodynamics with chemical examples.

lessons.name: Enthalpy, Entropy, and Free Energy
lessons.description: Introduces state functions and spontaneity criteria for chemical reactions.

lessons.name: Thermodynamic Equilibria
lessons.description: Analyzes equilibrium constants, Gibbs energy changes, and phase equilibrium.

name: Chemical Kinetics and Reaction Dynamics
description: Examines reaction rates, mechanisms, and molecular-level dynamics in chemistry.

lessons.name: Rate Laws and Reaction Order
lessons.description: Defines reaction rate, order, and rate constants through experimental methods.

lessons.name: Reaction Mechanisms and Catalysis
lessons.description: Explores multi-step reactions, intermediates, and the role of catalysts.

lessons.name: Temperature and Energy Dependence
lessons.description: Introduces the Arrhenius equation, activation energy, and collision theory.

name: Quantum Chemistry and Molecular Structure
description: Introduces quantum mechanics principles and their application to chemical bonding.

lessons.name: Fundamentals of Quantum Mechanics
lessons.description: Covers wave-particle duality, the Schrödinger equation, and operators.

lessons.name: Quantum Models of Atoms
lessons.description: Solves particle-in-a-box, hydrogen atom, and atomic orbital models.

lessons.name: Molecular Orbitals and Bonding
lessons.description: Describes the formation of molecular orbitals and chemical bonding using LCAO.

name: Elvish Linguistics and Phonology
description: Explores the structure, sound systems, and poetic aesthetics of Quenya and Sindarin.

lessons.name: Introduction to Elvish Languages
lessons.description: Covers the origins, distinctions, and historical development of Quenya and Sindarin.

lessons.name: Phonetics and Morphology in Quenya
lessons.description: Analyzes the sound system, root forms, and inflectional structure of Quenya.

lessons.name: Sindarin Syntax and Poetic Forms
lessons.description: Focuses on sentence structure, mutations, and poetic application in Sindarin.

name: Scripts and Calligraphy of Arda
description: Covers the Tengwar, Cirth, and other writing systems used across Middle-earth.

lessons.name: The Tengwar Alphabet
lessons.description: Introduces Feanor's script, its mode-based flexibility, and character construction.

lessons.name: Runes of the Dwarves: Cirth
lessons.description: Explores the angular Cirth runes, their adaptations by various races, and inscriptions.

lessons.name: Calligraphy and Inscriptions in Lore
lessons.description: Examines real and fictional examples of script in maps, doors, rings, and banners.

name: Translation, Etymology, and Philology
description: Examines the deep linguistic roots and translation challenges of Tolkien's constructed languages.

lessons.name: Etymologies and Root Lexicons
lessons.description: Traces the Elvish root system and etymological principles from 'The Etymologies'.

lessons.name: Translating Names and Songs
lessons.description: Practice in interpreting and translating names, songs, and proverbs from Middle-earth.

lessons.name: Comparative Philology in Middle-earth
lessons.description: Compares Elvish languages with Dwarvish (Khuzdul), the Black Speech, and Westron.

name: The Council of the Wise: Diplomacy through the Ages
description: Explores key historical events, councils, and alliances where inter-species diplomacy shaped Middle-earth.

lessons.name: The White Council and Its Purpose
lessons.description: Details the formation, goals, and political dynamics of the White Council, including Gandalf, Elrond, Galadriel, and Saruman.

lessons.name: The Last Alliance of Elves and Men
lessons.description: Examines the military and diplomatic unity forged by Gil-galad and Elendil during the War of the Last Alliance.

lessons.name: The Entmoot and the Voice of Nature
lessons.description: Explores the Entmoot as a non-humanoid diplomatic process and its impact during the War of the Ring.

name: Diplomatic Roles of Wizards and Elves
description: Analyzes how Istari and Eldar navigated diplomacy across species, time, and realms.

lessons.name: The Istari as Peacekeepers
lessons.description: Covers the origin, limitations, and political missions of the five wizards, especially Gandalf's neutral mediation role.

lessons.name: Elven Realms and Their Ambassadors
lessons.description: Highlights Elrond, Galadriel, and Thranduil’s diplomatic approaches in Rivendell, Lothlórien, and Mirkwood.

lessons.name: Language, Lore, and Power in Diplomacy
lessons.description: Explores how the mastery of languages and lore granted Elves political leverage and cultural authority.

name: Diplomacy between Realms of Men
description: Focuses on the kingdoms of Men—Gondor, Rohan, Númenor—and their role in regional and global diplomacy.

lessons.name: Gondor and Rohan: The Oath of Eorl
lessons.description: Examines the origins and renewal of the alliance between Gondor and Rohan during times of war.

lessons.name: The Fall of Númenor and Its Lessons
lessons.description: Analyzes how pride and imperial overreach led to Númenor’s collapse and disrupted interspecies harmony.

lessons.name: Diplomatic Protocols in the Age of Aragorn
lessons.description: Explores how King Elessar unified kingdoms and established diplomatic relations post-Sauron through policy, marriage, and memory.
